patterns: Can you tell me about Prime?
structure of Prime
about Prime
Please provide me some information about college
can i get more info about college?
Introduction please
responses: Prime College is an information technology, management, and science college in Pahiko Sadak, Nayabazar (Khusibu) Kathmandu, Nepal, established in 2001. The college offers courses for BBS (Bachelor of Business Studies) BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration), BBM (Bachelor of Business Management) BCA(Bachelor in Computer Application ), BIM (Bachelor of Information Management), B.Sc.(CSIT) which are affiliated with the Tribhuvan University of Nepal and CCNA (Cisco Certified Network Associate).

patterns: What is the fee structure for BCA?

Is there a fee structure available for all courses?
Where can I find more information about the fee structure?
responses:
The fee structure is as follows:
- BCA: 6 lakhs
- BIM: 6 lakhs
- BBS: 2 lakhs
- B.Sc. (CSIT): 9 lakhs 30 thousand
- BBA: 7 lakhs 50 thousand
- BBM: 4 lakhs 50 thousand
- MBS: 2 lakhs.
For more accurate details about the fee structure, please visit the college.

responses: Various Programs and Workshops are organized timely to motivate the students. Apart from this, councelling facility is provided to help the students to grab the right path

patterns: What are the procedure for admission?
Steps for admission
responses: Student must fill up entrance form and take the entrance exam conducted by Tribhuvan University. If student passes the entrance, he/she will be eligible for interview. After students are approved from interview ,then they can submit their admission fee in account section and submit other required documents in administration section. After entrance exam ,First you are called for interview. Within 2-3 days of interview you should submit admission fee based on availability of seats because the seats are filled by the procedure of First Come First Basis Admission

patterns: Is there any extra curriculum activities?
Is there any sport event?
is there any extra clubs?
What extracurricular opportunities are available?
What extra curriculum activities are conducted by college?
responses: Indoor games competitions, like Chess and Table Tennis, are conducted in summer season, and outdoor games competitions, like Badminton and Football are conducted in winter season. Any student of any level can take part in them. Various Indoor as well as Outdoor are conducted timely. Prime Student Clubs provide a platform to the students which helps them enhance their skills and guides them in their journey.

patterns: Is uniform complusory?
What about uniform?
Tell me about uniform
dress-code
responses: Yes, it is compulsory to be in uniform till 2nd year. Student without uniform is not eligible to attend the class at any cost till 2nd year. Students can wear business casual attire after their 2nd year or 4th semester. Carrying ID card is compulsory if your are not in college dress-code

patterns: Who can we apply for studying in college?
what are the requirement for applying?
how can i join the bachleor?
What are the academic requirements to qualify for the honors college?
responses: Candidate who has passed the 10+2 or PCL or any other equivalent examinations from a recognized academic institute with a second division (45% or above) or 1.8 CGPA and a minimum grade of 'D+' in all subjects of 11 and 12 are eligible to participate in this program. Documents required: Transcript and individual mark sheet of 11th, 12th, and SEE/SLC. Character certificate of SEE/SLC and 12th grade. Provisional and migration certificate of SEE/SLC and 12th-grade. Eligibility for Admission for Masters programs: Candidates who have passed their BBS at Tribhuvan University (TU) or another university recognized by TU. Or from any field with a Bachelor's degree from TU or a university recognized by TU. Documents Required: Transcript and individual mark sheet of 11th, 12th, and SEE/SLC bachelors level. Character certificate of 10+2 and Bachelor. Provisional and migration certificate of bachelor's.

patterns: Why is it important to attend my college classes?
Is attendance is necessary?
Can't i study at home?
responses: Students are required to attend all class discussions and seminars.
Maintaining at least 80% of participation(for semester-based programs only) in these activities is a criterion to be eligible for appearance in the final examination.

Attendance is one of the important factor for your internal marks, apart from that learning from professors may increase your knowledge than learning by yourself. Also attending class is more beneficial than wasting your leisure time

Attendance is a crucial aspect in your internal grades, and studying from professors can help you get more knowledge than learning on your own. Attending class is also preferable to waste your free time

Because it is dedicated to the country and people, with sound theoretical and practical knowledge, competence and skill.
Home for Quality higher education with an affordable fee

patterns: How is the WiFi on campus?

Are there any connectivity issues with the WiFi?
responses: The campus WiFi network is designed to provide reliable internet connectivity to students, faculty, and staff. However, occasional connectivity issues may arise, which are usually promptly addressed by the IT department.

patterns: Is it easy to get around campus?
Are the campus buildings easy to navigate?
Is the campus layout student-friendly?
responses: The campus is designed to be student-friendly, and campus buildings are typically well-marked and easy to navigate. Campus maps, signage, and digital resources are available to help students find their way around.

patterns: What options exist for leadership skills on campus?

How can students develop leadership skills?
responses: Our college offers various opportunities for students to develop leadership skills. Students can join student government, clubs, or organizations that provide leadership positions, participate in leadership workshops or programs, and engage in community service to foster leadership qualities.
